thread.title: School golf: Vineyard takes top honors
thread.title_full: School golf: Vineyard takes top honors

author: Cape Cod Times sports@capecodonline.com
title: School golf: Vineyard takes top honors
text: Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 10:26 PM By Cape Cod Times Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 10:26 PM » Social News DENNIS - The Martha’s Vineyard boys golf team won the MIAA Division 3 Cape Cod Sectional Qualifier for the second time in the past three years on Monday at Dennis Highlands Golf Course. Led by senior co-medalist Finn Simpkins’ 76, the Vineyarders (9-6-1), who compete in the tough Eastern Athletic Conference, had three players shoot in the 70s, all of them qualifying for the state individual tournament next week at Cummaquid Golf Club in Yarmouth Port. Simpkins’ MV teammates who were among the overall low six scores on the par-71 layout were Max Santos with a 77 and Zak Danz, who shot a 78. Each team had six players competing, with the four best scores determining the team score. The Vineyarders cruised to the sectional team title with a 315. Their fourth player, whose score figured in the total, was Chris Mayhew, who posted an 84. Sturgis West finished second in the team competition, by a single stroke over third-place Old Rochester. Sophomore Curtis Merritt led Sturgis West with a team-low 78, also qualifying for the state individual competition. The Navigators, the Cape & Islands League champions, finished at 329. Along with Merritt, Nick Harold (80), Samar Ghai (81) and Sam Goldberg (90) all figured in the final total. Sturgis West is advancing to the state finals for the first time in school history. Monomoy (344) was fourth in the team tourney, led by co-medalist Jacob Poitras, who shot a 76. Bourne took fifth at 349 with the final individual qualifier, Dawson Prophett, leading the Canalmen with a 78. Fairhaven (351), Mashpee (363), Sacred Heart (378), Sturgis East (382) and Upper Cape (404) rounded out the 10 team finishers. MIAA Div. 1 South: Barnstable finished fifth in the Division 1 South qualifier, won by Boston College High at Norton CC. Brookline was second and Xaverian third. Three schools in the 11-team field qualified for Monday’s state final at The Haven Country Club in Boylston. Barnstable was just seven shots back of Xaverian. Leading the Raiders was senior Bobby Harrington with an 80. MIAA Division 2 : Three of the Cape’s four Atlantic Coast League teams will be competing today to earn a berth in next week’s state Division 2 finals. Falmouth, Nauset and Sandwich will be playing at Easton Country Club. Also eligible to compete in the individual competition is Dennis-Yarmouth’s Ian De Armond. The state championship tournament is Monday at Crumpin-Fox Golf Club in Bernardston. By Cape Cod Times
